titles.title: Charter School Transparency and Accountability Act

To require each authorized public chartering agency to publish on the Internet the financial expenditures of each charter school that is authorized or approved by such agency and receives Department of Education funding.

bill.summary: 6/9/2010--Introduced. Charter School Transparency and Accountability Act - Requires each authorized public chartering agency, after the end of each school year, to publish on the Internet a detailed breakdown of the financial expenditures during that school year of each authorized or approved charter school that received, directly or indirectly, funds provided during the school year by the Secretary of Education. Penalizes agency noncompliance by denying federal funds to any such charter school until the agency complies.
